title: Academic Research Grant Narrative Tone & Engagement Optimizer
description: Optimize your academic research grant proposal narratives for tone, clarity, reviewer engagement, and alignment with funder priorities. Paste or upload narrative sections and funder guidelines to receive detailed tone analysis, jargon level, emotional engagement scores, section-level improvement suggestions, and sample revised snippets to enhance persuasiveness before submission.
inputLabel: Paste your grant proposal narrative text here or upload a text file. Optionally include funder guidelines and sample successful excerpts (paste or upload).
outputLabel: Tone analysis report summary, section-level suggestions, and revised narrative snippet recommendations.
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant specialized in analyzing academic research grant proposal narratives. Given the proposal text, optional funder guidelines, and sample excerpts, provide a detailed tone analysis including readability, jargon level, and emotional engagement. Then give clear, actionable, section-by-section suggestions to improve clarity, persuasiveness, and alignment with funder priorities. Provide sample revised text snippets illustrating enhanced storytelling and engagement. Do not generate new research content or make unsubstantiated claims. Maintain neutrality and do not guarantee funding success. Reject any input that appears to contain disallowed content or requests legal, ethical, or funding advice beyond narrative style guidance. Enforce input size limits and refuse unsupported file types. Output results as plain text unless structured output is enabled. Use professional, clear, and concise language.

presets.label: Readability Focus
presets.prompt: Analyze the narrative text focusing primarily on readability and jargon reduction. Provide suggestions to simplify complex sentences and improve clarity for diverse reviewer audiences.
presets.hint: Use this preset to make your proposal easier to read and understand.

presets.label: Engagement Emphasis
presets.prompt: Evaluate the narrative text for emotional engagement and storytelling flow. Suggest ways to strengthen persuasive elements and reviewer connection without compromising academic rigor.
presets.hint: Use this preset to increase the persuasive impact of your proposal.

presets.label: Funder Alignment
presets.prompt: Analyze the narrative text with special attention to alignment with the provided funder guidelines and reviewer criteria. Recommend adjustments to better meet funder priorities and expectations.
presets.hint: Use this preset to tailor your proposal tone to specific funders.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output a JSON object with 'toneAnalysisReport', 'sectionSuggestions', and 'revisedSnippets' fields, each containing detailed arrays keyed by section titles.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide your grant proposal narrative text and optionally the funder guidelines and sample successful excerpts. You may paste text directly or upload files. Ensure inputs do not exceed size limits and contain no disallowed content.
finalizePrompt: Review the analysis and suggestions carefully. Use the revised snippets as examples to iteratively improve your narrative sections before final submission. Remember to protect sensitive data and avoid unsubstantiated claims.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Grant Narrative Tone & Engagement Optimizer

niche.role: Academic Research Grant Writers and Coordinators
niche.scenario: Refining grant proposal narratives to improve reviewer engagement and persuasive impact before submission

idea.problem: Grant proposals often use overly technical, dense, or inconsistent narrative tones that reduce reviewer engagement and clarity, risking lower funding success. Existing tools focus on compliance, consistency, or budget analysis but do not help writers optimize narrative tone, storytelling flow, and emotional engagement tailored to different funder audiences.
inputs: Grant proposal narrative text sections (uploaded or pasted)
Funder-specific guidelines and reviewer criteria documents
Optional sample successful proposal excerpts for style reference
outputs: Detailed tone analysis report (e.g., readability, jargon level, emotional engagement)
Section-by-section suggestions to improve clarity, persuasiveness, and alignment with funder priorities
Revised narrative text snippets with enhanced storytelling and engagement elements
Summary recommendations for narrative coherence and impact enhancement
whyItWins: Addresses a real, under-served pain point in grant writing beyond compliance and formatting
Focuses on maximizing persuasive impact and reviewer engagement, which are critical to success
Supports iterative narrative refinement with actionable, section-level feedback
Enables improved alignment with diverse funder expectations through tailored tone guidance
Can start lightweight as a text analysis and suggestion tool, with potential for full collaborative editing and multi-proposal management

upgradePath.today: Single-page app accepting pasted or uploaded narrative texts and funder guidelines, producing tone and engagement feedback reports with sample rewrite suggestions
upgradePath.in90Days: Add user accounts and multi-section narrative management, enable side-by-side comparison of original and optimized text, incorporate reviewer feedback integration
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a multi-page collaborative platform for grant teams to co-edit narratives with real-time tone analytics, version control, funder-specific narrative templates, and success metric tracking

riskNotes: Avoid generating content that could misrepresent research or make unsubstantiated claims
Ensure no legal or ethical advice is provided about grants or funding beyond narrative style guidance
Protect sensitive proposal text with strong privacy and security controls
Maintain neutrality and do not guarantee funding success to manage user expectations

blueprint.summary: An app to help academic research grant writers optimize their proposal narratives for tone, engagement, and alignment with funder priorities through detailed analysis, actionable feedback, and iterative refinement.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic research grant writers and coordinators
successMetrics: User adoption rate among grant writers
Frequency of narrative refinements per proposal
Reduction in overly technical or unclear narrative sections
Retention rate for multi-proposal and collaborative features

components.name: Frontend UI
components.responsibility: Provide user interfaces for text input/upload, funder guideline submission, viewing tone analysis reports, suggestions, side-by-side comparisons, and collaborative editing.
notes: Start as single-page app with text input and report display
Evolve into multi-page app with user dashboard, proposal management, and collaboration
Support real-time updates for collaborative editing in future

components.name: API Backend
components.responsibility: Process narrative texts and funder guidelines, run tone and engagement analysis, generate suggestions, manage user accounts and proposals, and serve data to frontend.
notes: Expose RESTful endpoints for analysis, suggestions, user and proposal management
Validate inputs and sanitize outputs to protect sensitive data

components.name: Data Storage
components.responsibility: Persist user accounts, proposals, narrative sections, funder guidelines, analysis results, suggestions, and collaboration metadata.
notes: Ensure encryption at rest for sensitive proposal texts
Index on user and proposal IDs for efficient queries

components.name: NLP Analysis Engine
components.responsibility: Perform tone analysis, readability scoring, jargon detection, emotional engagement assessment, and generate section-level improvement suggestions.
notes: Use proven NLP libraries or services with customization for academic grant context
Avoid generating new content beyond suggestions to prevent misrepresentation
Process text asynchronously if large or complex

components.name: Background Jobs
components.responsibility: Handle asynchronous processing of large narrative texts, periodic data cleanup, notification dispatch for collaboration updates, and analytics aggregation.
notes: Queue analysis tasks to avoid blocking user requests
Schedule regular privacy audits and data retention enforcement

edgeCases: Handling very large narrative texts exceeding typical size limits
User uploads unsupported file formats or corrupted documents
Network failures during analysis or collaboration sessions
Concurrent edits causing merge conflicts in collaborative workspace
Users submitting sensitive or proprietary data requiring strict privacy controls
Analysis engine producing ambiguous or conflicting suggestions
Users attempting to bypass authentication or access unauthorized proposals
nonGoals: Generating original grant proposal content or rewriting full narratives autonomously
Providing legal, ethical, or funding advice beyond narrative style guidance
Guaranteeing funding success or reviewer acceptance
Handling budget, compliance, or formatting checks outside narrative tone and engagement
Supporting non-academic or non-grant writing domains initially

dataFlow: User accesses frontend pages (/, /dashboard, /proposal/:id, /collaboration/:proposalId) via Next.js routes.
On narrative upload or text input (/) page, frontend sends POST /api/analyze with narrativeText, optional funderGuidelines, and sampleExcerpts.
API backend validates input, stores narrative and guidelines temporarily, enqueues NarrativeAnalysisJob for asynchronous processing.
Background job calls NLP engine to analyze text, generates tone analysis report and suggestions, stores results in database linked to NarrativeSection.
Frontend polls or receives notification of analysis completion, displays tone analysis summary and section-level suggestions.
Authenticated users can create proposals via POST /api/proposals, which stores metadata and optional funder guidelines.
User dashboard (/dashboard) fetches proposals via GET /api/proposals, displaying list and analysis status.
Proposal detail page (/proposal/:id) fetches proposal, narrative sections, analysis reports, and suggestions via GET /api/proposals/:id.
User edits narrative sections via POST /api/proposals/:id/sections/:sectionId with revisedText, triggering re-analysis via background job.

Collaborative editing workspace (/collaboration/:proposalId) enables real-time text edits and comments, syncing changes through API and background jobs, with version control and user presence indicators.
Authentication via /api/auth/login and /api/auth/register manages user sessions and access control.
Background jobs handle queued analysis, notification dispatch, and periodic data cleanup enforcing privacy and retention.
validationRules: Narrative text must be non-empty string, max size limit (e.g., 100k characters) to prevent overload.
Funder guidelines optional, if present must be valid JSON or text, max size limit.
Sample excerpts, if provided, must be array of strings, each within size limits.
Proposal title required, non-empty string, max length (e.g., 255 chars).
Section text edits must be non-empty strings, sanitized to prevent injection.
User registration requires valid email format and password meeting complexity rules (min length, character variety).
Authentication tokens must be validated for all protected API routes.
File uploads must be validated for allowed MIME types (e.g., text/plain, application/pdf), size limits, and scanned for corruption.
API route parameters (e.g., proposalId, sectionId) must be validated as valid UUID or string identifiers and ownership verified.
Concurrent edits must be versioned to detect and resolve conflicts.
errorHandling: Return 400 Bad Request for invalid input with descriptive error messages.
Return 401 Unauthorized for unauthenticated access to protected routes.
Return 403 Forbidden if user attempts to access or modify proposals or sections they do not own.
Return 404 Not Found if requested proposal, section, or analysis data does not exist.
Return 413 Payload Too Large for narrative texts or uploads exceeding size limits.
Gracefully handle NLP engine failures by returning partial results or retrying analysis asynchronously.
Use try-catch blocks in API routes to log errors and return 500 Internal Server Error with generic message.
For network failures during collaboration, implement client-side retry and conflict resolution UI.
Validate and sanitize all inputs to prevent injection and XSS attacks.
Notify users of analysis queue delays or failures via UI messages or notifications.
securityNotes: Implement JWT or session-based authentication with secure cookie flags and expiration.
Encrypt sensitive data at rest, especially proposal texts and user credentials.
Hash passwords securely using bcrypt or similar algorithms.
Sanitize all user inputs and outputs to prevent XSS and injection attacks.
Authorize all API requests to ensure users only access their own proposals and data.
Validate and restrict file uploads to safe types and sizes, scan for malware.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communication.
Implement rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent abuse.
Log authentication attempts and suspicious activities for audit.
Ensure background jobs respect user privacy and data retention policies.
